name: CloudFoundryCLI
description: Run a command using the Cloud Foundry command line interface.
author: Microsoft

inputs.name: cfEndpoint
inputs.label: Cloud Foundry Endpoint
inputs.helpMarkDown: Service endpoint for your Cloud Foundry instance.

inputs.name: skipSSLValidation
inputs.label: Skip SSL Validation
inputs.helpMarkDown: Skip SSL validation when connecting to the Cloud Foundry endpoint.

inputs.name: oneTimePassword
inputs.label: Use One-time Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use a one-time password to login to the Cloud Foundry instance.

inputs.name: ssoPasscode
inputs.label: One-time Passcode
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the one-time passcode to login to the Cloud Foundry instance. To acquire the one-time passcode, run cf CLI login command with --sso option.

inputs.name: org
inputs.label: Org
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally specify the org to login to on the Cloud Foundry instance. The default org will be used if nothing is specified.

inputs.name: space
inputs.label: Space
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally specify the space to login to on the Cloud Foundry instance. The default space will be used if nothing is specified.

inputs.name: cfCommand
inputs.label: Command
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Cloud Foundry CLI command to run. Run `cf help` to get complete list of commands or refer to: http://docs.cloudfoundry.org/cf-cli/getting-started.html

inputs.name: cfArguments
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: The arguments to pass to the Cloud Foundry CLI command. Run `cf <command> --help` to get complete list of arguments supported by the command.

inputs.name: workingDirectory
inputs.label: Working Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: The working directory to run the Cloud Foundry CLI commands.

inputs.name: cfToolLocation
inputs.label: Cloud Foundry CLI Location
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally specify the location to the cf CLI. If location is not specified, cf CLI needs to be in the PATH.

messages.CLINotFound: cf CLI is not found in the path. Install the cf CLI: https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cli.
messages.EndPointCredentials: Failed to login to the Cloud Foundry endpoint. Verify the URL and credentials.
